ratings.comment: He doesn't teach anything. you ask questions and he acts like he explained everything in the past so thoroughly. I felt like i was always bothering him when visiting him in the office for questions. Don't take the course if you want to clearly understand the material and learn . I taught myself everything.

Ricardo's power lectures could get long, but he usually let us out early. I personally had no difficulty with the tests or the homework assignments (1 Aplia assignment a week), but I went to most lectures and read the textbook. All exams were approximately 30 multiple choice questions. The curve was very generous (25% get As).

As it was his last semester at UW, before leaving to go to another institution, he was very out of it. He cancelled at least 5 lectures and no lecture went the full time. I wanted to learn the information better and felt inhibited by his seeming lack of interest and laziness. His lectures are almost too to the point. Didn't enjoy the class.

He lectures didn't waste time.  With that being said, he went too quickly over concepts at times. Expect to study a ton on your own through the online assignments and textbook, the latter being vital to success in this course. I found his tests to be very challenging, but he was supplied a generous curve.
As far as being a professor he's slightly above average, his tests are hard but he's very generous with the curves! Also he's adorable and usually cuts his power lectures a little short
Terrible instructions, tests were much too difficult, teaching assistants were HORRIBLE. Overall a terrible experience.

Ricardo is a baller. He writes out the notes and graphs on an overhead in class which makes the concepts easier to grasp. Exams and homework were a little tough, but that was more a departmental thing than a Serrano-Padial thing.   Overall, would recommend.

Literally couldn't understand what he was saying with his accent. I had to focus more on understanding what he said than understanding the material. Pay attention, READ, and do the practice tests and youll do fine. Its not an easy class though, especially if ur not a busecon major.

The was fairly easy if you are good at matching terms to equations. He gives a lot of practice examspast exams before midterms and finals. DO THEM. I studied solely based on them and notes from lecture. Didn't even open the text. Got 98% in the class. Just go to lecture and write it all down. His accent wasn't bad at all.

He has a very strong accent and while you can understand what he says I was still distracted by it at the end of the semester. Homework was an easy grade booster and tests were fair. He is generally a happy persona and since many people did well on the midterms he made a more generous grade distribution.
Nice guy, easy class.  Tests are straightforward and fair.
Really nice guy and pretty funny.  Practice tests are the best thing to prepare you for the exams.  The homework is really easy.  Try to get an English speaking TA. Take instead of Kelly.
Best professor! Make things easy to understand. Easy to follow.
Accent lol

course was split between serrano and gandhi. serrano was MUCH better than gandhi.  easy to understand, really takes the time to write things out and go through examples. gandhi just threw slides onto the projector.  serrano's test was more fair as well; be sure to do the previous exams posted online, they're VERY similar to what you will see

Serrano was definitely one of the better professors I've had here. Very organized and clear lecture. His accent is very understandable. His lectures did a good job of explaining what the concept is, and examples of how it is used. Definitely better than Gandhi and prepared us for the test better than Gandhi did. Good professor.
Great guy. Funny. Way better than ghandi as 101 prof. i dont fall asleep in his lectures as often as ghandi's.

Fair teacher and class that really doesn't require too much time. Didn't really find lectures that pertinent, but the discussions taught you how to do everything. No attendance taken ever. The book is really good and makes material easy to understand.

Serrano is a really great guy with a fun sense of humor. Econ has never interested me and never will so I personally thought the class was hard and boring. However, the homework was very easy and he is very organized and easy to follow!

I hardly ever went to lecture, but when I did, the lectures were pretty alright. He knows his stuff and he's kinda funny. Homework was very easy, exams were very easy, and I had no problem getting an A despite spending less than an hour on the class per week

If you put in some work (go to lectures, read the book and do weekly homework) you should have no problem getting a good grade. His lectures can get boring sometimes, but he throws in some jokes and interesting examples. Exams are not too terrible and have a great curve. Reading the book either before or after lecture helps a lot! Overall good prof

Alright prof, pretty hard to understand and kind of boring. Fairly straightforward exams that aren't too tough. Easy homework but it doesnt help with exams really. Either read book or go to lecture, both help about equally. BLC helps a lot

Good professor with a great sense of humor (referring to the Arrested Development themed exam questions). His lectures are helpful but boring, and mostly highlight key points of the textbook. Problem sets are really easy, but aren't very representative of exam-type questions. Just keep up with the readings and go to discussion and you'll be fine.

Class is the easiest I have taken by a long shot. Lectures are useless, I went to the first two and not a single one after that and had no problem getting an A. Read over the Chapters a couple days before the exam, and know all of the terms and this class is a breeze. Grades take forever to be put up, though.

If you have to take this class, he is a good teacher to take it with. His grading system is nice and usually he curves because the averages aren't super high. Don't need to buy the book because you use an online program that has the book with (hw is online too). I would recommend this class, it was interesting and pretty easy as long as you tried.

Great guy.  I rarely went to lecture though... Something about a 9:30 power lecture was a disincentive.  Despite not attending class I managed AB's on his exams so I'd say theyre not that bad.  When I did go to lecture I could follow him really easily; the material was just boring.  I'd choose Ricardo if i took the class again Plus he watches lost!

Kind of an odd guy and I felt that he didn't teach well but he at least taught everything that was going to be on the tests. The book really didn't need to be bought because you get it online with Aplia. So do that just buy the Aplia package not the physical book, trust me on this one. You hardly use the book anyway.

He's funny and nice. His lectures are really boring, but that's just because the subject is boring. He was a pretty good lecturer. Exams were fair. I had a really good TA, which really helped. Homework assignments are done on the computer. I never really read the textbook and was fine without it.

Lecture are boring and his accent sometimes makes it hard to understand what he's saying. The weekly assignments are never that hard but don't really apply to exams. The text chapters are long but helpful. Before every exam he goes over what will be on it so don't miss that day, it's really helpful. For me Econ. was just a hard class
Really knows what he is talking about and has excellent lecture notes. Read+go to lecture=A. Tries to make econ somewhat interesting. Take his class
VERY BORING!!!!!!!!Hate the class...avoid if you can.
If you go to lecture and spend some time on the weekly assignments you shouldn't have trouble getting an AB.

If you take this class, prepare for the inevitable suicidal thoughts. His lectures are so incomprehensibly boring that I started to slit my wrists with my mechanical pencil six minutes into it. Don't bother going to the lecture because even while trying to distract yourself with texttwist you will bleed your your eyes. Go to exams, you'll get an A.

A cute accent and sometimes had funny jokes.  Overall though, VERY BORING.  He admits that it is a very boring topic, but doesn't do much to make it anymore interesting.  The exams were pretty easy if you either went to lecture (and managed to stay awake) or read the book.

For a 101 class, it was more difficult that I expected.  I have never been strong in Econ, but I enjoyed his lectures. He has a cute, foreign sense of humor and can get the class to laugh at cheesy jokes.  His exams are difficult to prepare for, but the weekly assignments are not too hard. Overall, I enjoyed the class & the prof. :)
Serrano is a good professor. Forget what people say about him being incomprehensible, his speaking is fine. The material is boring no matter what and his tests are fair. I recommend taking his class.

The lectures were death, but if you go to lecture, you dont have to read the book so it was worth it. He has a frustrating habit of removing the last page of notes before you have enough time to copy it, then he doesnt write anything more for a minute. Most of the ideas seem like common sense. online homework is easy when you work in groups.

I was excited to take this class, but about half way through I just wanted it to end.  The professor is boring and sometimes difficult to understand.  He doesn't seem passionate about what he's teaching and didn't get me excited about the material.

My friend said if one can understand what he says, then book is useless...However, by no means one can understand  understand all he say...so, reading is always important, his note is helpful and the exams are oK.  Anyway, he's nice.
He is a boring lecturer. Don't bother going for his lectures if you can study on your own. I hate his accent!
Lectures are long and sometimes boring but as long as you take good notes you wont have to touch the text at all.
Competent professor but very boring lectures. I found the book more useful than the lectures. doing the problems sets and talking with my TA helped me the most.

Hard to understand in lecture. Don't bother going. Do problem sets and attend discussion. The book used--- is honestly very interesting. The book uses good examples/pictures/is easy to follow. Instead of going to lecture read each chapter he assigns in the book and take notes. Seems like a nice guy! 75 min lecture is just too long!

The lectures are extremely boring power lectures, so the answer is simple...don't go to them. Just read the book and do his problem sets and you'll be fine. The class is basically just interpreting graphs and its not too bad despite what people say
extremely well dressed.  accent makes it easy to ignore what hes saying in lecture
go to take the course

The class isn't easy at all, but he's way better than the other bozos teaching micro.  he's fair and doesn't throw in any suprise tricks, so if you understand what he said in lecture and the hw probles, then you're golden for the exam.  oh and the textbook is worthless

He's a nice guy but the ONLY way I got an A in this class was through a great TA and a tutor that I met with multiple times a week...you have to try really hard to do well...read the book, get a tutor, and go to office hours.
Class was boring. Professor was hard to understand and his notes were not that clear. He often made mistakes and didn't go over the same material covered in the weeks HW.

He has an accent which was wierd at first but i soon got used to it. His lectures are pretty boring, but relate to the material well overall. I went into each test without much confidence and did fine on each (his curves are huge. ex: a 60% was usually good for a B or B- on all of the exams)

Good prof, especially for a first year econ teacher. His tests were the perfect difficulty level. I liked that the homework was sometimes more difficult than the exams. Go to his office hours, it helps A TON, he's awesome.
He explained everything extremely thoroughly, but why bother going to lecture when you could read the book faster?
Nice guy, boring lecturer. Tests are fair but sometimes the wording is a little tricky. If you just go to lecture you don't need to touch the book.

Boring lecturer. Mumbles, looks down for the majority of lecture while he writes stuff on the dot cam. Doesn't prepare anything for lecture, makes plenty of mistkes. Because he was innarticulate about concepts and failed to touch on the process of going about solving similar problems we would see on exams, made class harder then it should have been

Hes a pretty good prof with a sweet accent, def a good alternative to Hertel. My only problem with him was that he sometimes overcomplicated some of the topics. the tests are fair and with the curve its not that hard to at least get a B. I found that the best way to study was to redo the HW and make sure u really understand the concepts.

Does a pretty good job of making the material clear, but many of the concepts are just hard.  His tests are very fair, and he will make sure you know what to study. All in all a solid choice but not awesome.

The class in general is hard, but he's a really good teacher...very organized and fair. His exams aren't easy, but the questions are basically out of the homework and lecture, no suprises or tricks.  Class is boring, but if you actually go, he goes through all the problems you need to know...and he as a cool accent.
No Comments
No Comments
